body:
If I open the root of my copy of the packages/flutter_tools/flutter_tools.iml ends up modifed

```
git status
...
Your branch is up-to-date with 'upstream/master'.
...

Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)

	modified:   packages/flutter_tools/flutter_tools.iml
```
The diff refers to a non-existent directory:
```
diff --git a/packages/flutter_tools/flutter_tools.iml b/packages/flutter_tools/flutter_tools.iml
index 2efda708b..bacc36a42 100644
--- a/packages/flutter_tools/flutter_tools.iml
+++ b/packages/flutter_tools/flutter_tools.iml
@@ -41,6 +41,7 @@
       <excludeFolder url="file://$MODULE_DIR$/test/src/base/packages" />
       <excludeFolder url="file://$MODULE_DIR$/test/src/ios/packages" />
       <excludeFolder url="file://$MODULE_DIR$/test/src/packages" />
+      <excludeFolder url="file://$MODULE_DIR$/test/src/runner/packages" />
       <excludeFolder url="file://$MODULE_DIR$/tool/packages" />
     </content>
     <orderEntry type="inheritedJdk" />
```

```
find . -name runner
./packages/flutter_tools/test/src/runner
./packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/runner

ls ./packages/flutter_tools/test/src/runner
flutter_command_test.dart
```

It seems like this shouldn't happen. Flutter and my IDE are up to date ("check for updates" says there aren't any updates).

comment_data.body:
My guess is that the file `packages/flutter_tools/test/src/runner/flutter_command_test.dart` was added to the repo recently, and that `flutter_tools.iml` hasn't been updated w/ the change. The `runner/packages` exclusion in that file is for a potential packages dir - it doesn't have to exist for IntelliJ to want to create that exclusion (just the parent `runner/` dir).

We're tracking the the issue to reduce the amount of SCM churn in this jetbrains issue: https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/oauth?state=%2Fissue%2FWEB-25293.

The latest IDE still modifies `flutter_tools.iml` and now also modifies:

```
examples/flutter_gallery/android/app/src/main/java/
examples/flutter_gallery/ios/Runner/PluginRegistry.h
examples/flutter_gallery/ios/Runner/PluginRegistry.m
```
@HansMuller, I think the issue with the new files you're running into is discussed at the end of this bug: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/9299.
(but we should update the .iml files as well)

This problem seems to have gotten worse. Now when I open the entire flutter repo the following files are reported as modified:
```
Your branch is up-to-date with 'upstream/master'.
Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)

	modified:   dev/bots/bots.iml
	modified:   dev/devicelab/devicelab.iml
	modified:   examples/flutter_gallery/flutter_gallery.iml
	modified:   examples/hello_world/hello_world.iml
	modified:   packages/flutter/flutter.iml
	modified:   packages/flutter_driver/flutter_driver.iml
	modified:   packages/flutter_markdown/flutter_markdown.iml
	modified:   packages/flutter_test/flutter_test.iml
	modified:   packages/flutter_tools/flutter_tools.iml

Untracked files:
  (use "git add <file>..." to include in what will be committed)

	examples/flutter_gallery/android/app/src/main/java/
	examples/flutter_gallery/ios/Runner/PluginRegistry.h
	examples/flutter_gallery/ios/Runner/PluginRegistry.m
```

Running the latest version as far as I know:
```
IntelliJ IDEA 2016.3.1
Build #IC-163.9166.29, built on December 9, 2016
JRE: 1.8.0_112-release-408-b2 amd64
JVM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM by JetBrains s.r.o
```
Ah, the files committed are for `2017.1` - looks like you're on `2016.3.1`. I believe the version of IntelliJ that you're on will be upgraded early next week.
I filed https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/9460 to take care of those untracked files; I'm not sure if we want to commit them or gitignore them.
Given the resolution of https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/9460, is this safe to close?
Yup, the soon-to-be-released Dart plugin will reduce the churn quite a bit.

Reopening because this is still a problem.  I have a bunch of .iml files that are immediately modified when I open a newly-cloned repo in Intellij:
```
On branch master
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/master'.

Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)

	modified:   dev/bots/bots.iml
	modified:   dev/devicelab/devicelab.iml
	modified:   examples/flutter_gallery/flutter_gallery.iml
	modified:   examples/hello_world/hello_world.iml
	modified:   packages/flutter/flutter.iml
	modified:   packages/flutter_driver/flutter_driver.iml
	modified:   packages/flutter_test/flutter_test.iml
	modified:   packages/flutter_tools/flutter_tools.iml

no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")
```
Can we put them into the .gitignore and just update them occasionally when a new package is added?  Can we automate updating them by just opening a recent IntelliJ on a newly-cloned repo every so often and committing the changes?

This will still be an issue for 2017.1 versions of intellij - the fix was in the version of the dart plugin that's compatible with 2017.2. (the internal intellij is still on 2017.1, so you'll still see it with that version).

I've been using 2017.2 for a while and it hasn't touched my `.iml` files, until today. I reopened IntelliJ today and saw this diff applied to some of my `.iml` files:

```diff
$ git diff examples/flutter_gallery/flutter_gallery.iml
diff --git a/examples/flutter_gallery/flutter_gallery.iml b/examples/flutter_gallery/flutter_gallery.iml
index fe958dffb..6beca6a06 100644
--- a/examples/flutter_gallery/flutter_gallery.iml
+++ b/examples/flutter_gallery/flutter_gallery.iml
@@ -8,7 +8,7 @@
       <excludeFolder url="file://$MODULE_DIR$/build" />
     </content>
     <orderEntry type="sourceFolder" forTests="false" />
-    <orderEntry type="library" name="Dart Packages" level="project" />
     <orderEntry type="library" name="Dart SDK" level="project" />
+    <orderEntry type="library" name="Dart Packages" level="project" />
   </component>
-</module>
+</module>
\ No newline at end of file
```

Workaround: I closed IntelliJ, reverted the `.iml` files then opened again and so far it has not applied this change again ðŸ¤ž
The iml files are now ignored.

milestone.description: Work triaged but not yet planned for a specific release.
milestone.title: Backlog

title: Point IDE at flutter repo, modifies flutter_tools.iml
